intro: Astrochlaena floccosa, commonly known as the fluffcap, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Gomphostomataceae family. It is characterized by its unique, fluffy, white to pale yellow cap that resembles a cloud, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories or along stream banks. Its structure includes a short, sturdy stem and a single, broad, umbrella-like cap. Astrochlaena floccosa is notable for its delicate appearance and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity.
